article.description: Allen Iverson scored 36 points and Corie Blount added a season-high 15 as the Philadelphia 76ers headed to the All-Star break with a 100-93 victory over the Charlotte Hornets.
article.headline: Sixers head into break with winning record

images.name: Iverson, Allen 020207 inline
images.caption: Allen Iverson scored 36 points and found time to hand out four assists.

article.linkText: Iverson scores 36 to beat Hornets, boost Sixers above .500
article.story:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Allen Iverson was on target, and the rest of the Philadelphia 76ers were in the zone, too. Iverson scored 36 points on 16-for-30 shooting, including two late driving baskets, as the Philadelphia 76ers beat the Charlotte Hornets 100-93 on Thursday night. Matt Harpring added 16 points to help the Sixers improve to 25-24 and end a two-game losing streak. Baron Davis led the Hornets with 23 points and 10 assists, and Lee Nailon had 18 points. "Was that the ugliest zone or what?" Sixers coach Larry Brown said. "We zone pressed, we zoned, and it was ugly. We even started zoning when we weren't calling it, but we did some good things." Philadelphia's Corie Blount tipped in Dikembe Mutombo's miss to give the 76ers a 91-89 lead with 3:43 left, and Iverson followed with a pair of off-balance runners to put the Sixers ahead 95-89. "I've been trying to stick to what I do best, and that's defend and get rebounds," Blount said. "But it seems like I've gotten my hands on a lot of balls the last couple of games." Davis missed a 3-pointer with 23 seconds left, with the score 96-93, and Philadelphia sealed the win at the free-throw line. "We didn't push up on Allen," Charlotte coach Paul Silas said. "He had too many open looks and knocked a lot of shots down. And we didn't execute well down the stretch." With a dunk and a 3-pointer from Iverson, Philadelphia scored the first nine points of the fourth quarter to take an 84-75 lead, but Charlotte cut it to 84-83 on Davis' layup with 6:30 left. "We were playing well and got used to winning, and then we dropped a couple of games," Iverson said. "This gives us a chance to leave on a positive note. Corie played well and Dikembe Mutombo did a great job on the boards. The whole front line played well." The Hornets led 50-47 at halftime, thanks to a 6-0 flurry in the final 1:02 of the second period. Iverson had given the 76ers a 47-44 advantage with a 19-foot jumper with 1:29 left, but three straight Charlotte layups in a 25-second stretch -- by P.J. Brown, Davis and Bryce Drew -- completed the scoring with 37 seconds left.

Game notes
Iverson's 16-of-30 shooting performance followed a dreadful effort Tuesday night in Detroit. He missed his final 11 shots against the Pistons and finished with 26 points on 7-of-31 shooting. ... Mutombo had 17 rebounds to improve on his 13.6 career average against the Hornets. ... Charlotte forward Robert Traylor saw his first action since going on the injured list Jan. 23 because of a sprained right ankle.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
